summary: This document is an article from the New York Post that lists some of New York City's most eligible bachelors, highlighting their backgrounds, professions, and personal lives. Among those mentioned is Jeffrey Epstein, noted for his wealth and connections, including a private plane used to transport Bill Clinton. The article provides a mix of positive and negative traits for each individual.

persons.name: Andre Balazs
persons.context: Andre Balazs is mentioned as a hotelier who owns several high-profile hotels and has recently split from his wife.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Jeffrey Epstein is described as a mystery billionaire with a background as a math teacher and connections to wealthy individuals, including handling Leslie Wexner's money.

persons.name: Uma Thurman
persons.context: Uma Thurman is mentioned in relation to Andre Balazs, suggesting he is providing her emotional support.

persons.name: Bill Clinton
persons.context: Bill Clinton is noted for having been flown to Africa on Epstein's private plane.

persons.name: Leslie Wexner
persons.context: Leslie Wexner is mentioned as someone whose money Epstein began handling.

persons.name: Mort Zuckerman
persons.context: Mort Zuckerman is referenced in relation to a failed attempt to buy New York magazine with Epstein.

persons.name: Katie Ford
persons.context: Katie Ford is mentioned as the ex-wife of Andre Balazs.

persons.name: Chris Barish
persons.context: Chris Barish is noted for selling his interest in Las Vegas nightclubs.

persons.name: Jimmy Rodriguez
persons.context: Jimmy Rodriguez is mentioned as a successful restaurateur with a four-restaurant empire.

connections.description: Epstein began handling Wexner's money, indicating a financial relationship.
Epstein used his private plane to take Clinton to Africa, indicating a close relationship.
Balazs is mentioned as providing emotional support to Thurman after his split from his wife.
Balazs recently split from his wife, Katie Ford.
Epstein was one of Zuckerman's partners in a failed business venture.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was a math teacher before becoming a billionaire.
Epstein handled Leslie Wexner's money and lived in Manhattan's biggest mansion.
Epstein had a private plane that he used to transport Bill Clinton to Africa.
Andre Balazs recently split from his wife Katie Ford.
There are several mentions of notable individuals in the context of their social and professional lives.
